Recipe.Description:
This is a fancy (a.k.a. French) word for finely diced root vegetables.
This stuff is used extensively in garnishes and sauces.
Make it up in large batches and freeze it in sandwich bags in a large plastic container -it keeps for months.

Prerequisites.Prerequisite: Large pot of salted, boiling water.

Method.Step: Blanch each vegetable separately in boiling salted water (Do each batch in a chinois to get it in and out of the water quickly) for a minute or so, until it's just tender and the color is set, then submerge under cold water before turning out onto paper toweling to drain.
Mix all the batches together and use as needed, keep refrigerated for a few days or freeze for a few months.

Variations.Variation: Can also use other vegetables such as celery, fennel, parsnips, radish, etc.
